SEARCH
Package clientSide

Class ChatClient

java.lang.Object
ocsf.client.AbstractClient
clientSide.ChatClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ChatClient extends ocsf.client.AbstractClient
ChatClient represents the client-side connection to the server in the BPARK system. It handles communication over the OCSF framework, dispatches messages to relevant controllers, and manages user-specific session context such as active subscriber or controller..

  • Constructor Details

    • ChatClient

      public ChatClient(String host, int port, ChatIF clientUI) throws IOException
      Constructs a ChatClient and opens a connection to the server.
      Parameters:
      host - The server host.
      port - The server port.
      clientUI - The UI interface for displaying messages.
      Throws:
      IOException - if connection fails.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static ChatClient getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the ChatClient. This method provides global access to the single ChatClient instance, ensuring that only one client is used throughout the application.
      Returns:
      the existing instance of ChatClient, or null if it has not been initialized yet.

    • setController

      public void setController(BaseController controller)
      Sets the current UI controller that the ChatClient will interact with.
      Parameters:
      controller - A controller implementing the BaseController interface.

    • handleMessageFromServer

      public void handleMessageFromServer(Object msg)
      Handles incoming messages from the server and delegates them based on type. Supported types include Strings, Lists, domain-specific responses, and objects.
      Parameters:
      msg - The message received from the server.

    • sendToServerSafe

      public void sendToServerSafe(String msg)
      Sends a message to the server with internal exception handling. In case of failure, an error message is displayed to the user.
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to send.

    • quit

      public void quit()
      Closes the connection to the server and terminates the application.
